about_the_game:
Vesalii Anatomy VR Student


The application allows users to view, explore, and interact with any system of the human body systems through an incredibly detailed 3D model. The application also enables viewing CT, MRI, and X-ray images in 3D. The aim of the application is to make an easily accessible way to study the human body and how it comes together. The body systems covered by this application include the skeletal system, muscular system, cardiovascular system, nervous system, lymphatic system, joints, endocrine system, digestive system, urinary system, respiratory system, reproductive system, and integumentary system.

To develop the 3D model for this application, Vesalii consulted anatomists and doctors and even hired anatomy specialists to be part of its in-house team. This diligent work and determination for a medically accurate representation of the human body resulted in the high-quality 3D model that Vesalii offers to its users.

Vesalii did not stop at that; it also worked on developing and implementing interactive tools in the application that make it easier and more time-efficient to work and explore the model. Additionally, detailed anatomical text information for each part in each system was developed and included to enhance understanding of human body structures.

These tools allow users to isolate single or multiple structures, layers, or organs and compare them with other structures or view them from multiple angles to comprehensively understand the part and its relationship to nearby structures.

Vesalii Anatomy VR Student is comprehensive as it offers additional features and extensive medical content and a database that also cover:
  • Radiology
  • Histology
The Free version of Vesalii functions as a demo, offering access to a limited set of features. Unlock the full potential of Vesalii by upgrading to the Pro version through a license purchase, granting you access to all features (check our website for a detailed comparison of the Free and Pro versions). With a valid license, you can enjoy the complete application experience on any supported platform and device. Simply log in to the application on any device using the email address and password associated with your Vesalii profile account to access all features seamlessly. Additionally, simultaneous logins on two separate devices or platforms are permitted.

Systems Of The Body

Twelve systems of the human body are available :


  • skeletal System
    Comprehensive and impeccably detailed model of the human skeletal system. See and study the skeletal system as you have never before.

  • muscular System
    Detailed execution of the muscular system accurately shows the origin and insertion of skeletal muscles to show how they are related to bones and how they act on joints or support the body.

  • cardiovascular System
    Look deep into the immensely detailed cardiovascular system from the heart and major arteries and veins to the smallest capillaries throughout the human body.

  • nervous System
    Easily look into and learn about one of the most complex systems of the human body: the nervous system. Trace nerve pathways from source to target to better understand how this intricate system works.

  • lymphatic System
    Discover the lymphatic system with all its vessels and nodes in a fully constructed and accurate 3D model.

  • joints System
    Learn all you need to know about the joints system and how it relates to other systems of the body, especially the skeletal and muscular systems.

  • respiratory System
    View all the respiratory system components, including the lungs and their incredibly detailed bronchial tree.

  • endocrine System
    Learn about the endocrine system and how its glands help keep the body functioning like clock-work. The model of the endocrine system includes all the glands and glandular cells of the endocrine system.

  • digestive System
    View and learn using an accurate model of the digestive tract and the supporting digestive organs to gain a complete understanding of the human digestive system.

  • urinary System
    Explore and find out more about the kidneys and other components of the urinary system of the human body, and learn about the important differences between male and female anatomy in this system.

  • integumentary System
    See the skin and its appendages on the incredibly detailed model to learn all you could about the integumentary system.

  • reproductive System
    Explore the reproductive system of both the male and female body in great detail.

Application Tools

Vesalii Anatomy VR Student come with various innovative tools that make for a more user-friendly experience and facilitate the study of anatomy, radiology, and histology.


  • discovery
    The discovery tool allows you to explore the layers of the body below the surface. You to select more than one system with this tool to look through each with ease.

  • drawing
    The drawing tool is designed to allow you to draw lines directly on the 3D body parts of the model or on a board in the background, giving you more freedom to focus on the body parts you want or write down your notes.

  • explode
    The explode tool breaks down certain parts to their primary components to give you a complete picture of how these parts come together to form a whole.

  • fade
    The fade tool gives the selected part an almost transparent texture, allowing you to see where the part is and what lies beneath it all at the same time.

  • hide
    The hide tool removes the selected part completely from the scene to allow you to discover what parts or layers lie underneath.

  • manage Modules
    The manage modules tool is available with the modules plugin to give you better access and control over modules. It allows you to view all available modules and easily create and save new ones for use at any time.

  • screenshot
    The screenshot tool allows you to capture a screenshot of the current scene and save it on your device to view or study at any time.

  • isolate
    The isolate tool can be used to isolate a selected part or group. i.e., only the isolated part or group will be visible in the scene. This gives faster and more streamlined control over what you wish to observe in the scene and how you want to approach it.

  • sticker
    The stickers tool enables you to pin notes on any body part you desire, allowing you to write personalized notes you can back to later and quickly pick up where you left off.

  • transform tool
    The transform tool is used to rotate the model of the body on any of the three axes (X, Y, and Z) to allow you to view the model or any body part exactly from the angle you desire.

  • heart play/stop
    The heart play\stop tool is an amazing way to add a more realistic aspect to the model. The tool can be used to play or stop the heartbeat with a realistic motion and the distinctive sound of a beating heart.

  • select/reset/move
    With the select tool, you can choose any body part on the model and freely move it or rotate it to see it in the way you desire. You can then use the reset to return the part to its original position.

  • duplicate
    The duplicate tool allows the user to create a duplicate copy of the selected body part to help compare it with others at the same time and in the same view.

  • fade others
    The fade others tool enables the user to fade all the body parts visible in the scene except for the selected part or group, which allows for a better view of the selected part while still able to see its location in relation to neighboring parts.

  • freeze
    The freeze tool allows the user to freeze a part or group, preventing any action from being taken on that part. The part or group must be unfrozen first for any action to be taken.

  • freeze All
    The freeze all tool allows the user to freeze all parts appearing in the scene, preventing any action from being taken on the part. The parts must be unfreezed first for any action to be taken.

  • part Label
    This tool is used to display labels that point to the part or group and show its name for easier reference.

  • neighbor Parts
    The Neighbor Parts tool allows you to view the body parts that are adjacent to the part you selected. The parts appearing using this tool can be filtered by the body systems, so that neighboring parts of a certain system only appear.

  • rotate
    The rotate tool is used to rotate the selected body part in any direction to help you easily see it from different angles.

Vesalii Plugins

In addition to the numerous features of applications, Vesalii offers even more features that can be purchased according to your needs.


  • tracing
    The tracing add-on enables you to trace the path of all available blood vessels from the heart to the parts they supply. You can also trace nerve pathways, both sensory and motor, from the brain or spinal cord to the part they innervate.

  • histology
    The histology add-on gives you access to more than 1,500 histology images depicting real tissues that cover the entire body. This feature is a great addition to help have a better understanding of the relationship between gross anatomy and microanatomy.

  • modules
    The modules add-on gives users access to more than 2,000 anatomical modules pre-created by Vesalii. These modules can be viewed and analyzed using the application tools at any time. In addition to these pre-created modules, you can also create your own modules and save them to the application so you can go back to them whenever you desire.

  • radiology
    The radiology add-on provides you with over 4,000 medical images taken via several techniques, including CT scans, MRI, and X-ray. These medical images cover the entire body from all planes (axial, sagittal, and coronal). This is an invaluable addition to the application if you are looking to understand the relation between medical imaging and anatomy.

application Features

Vesalii Anatomy is laden with features that enrich and enhance the users’ experience to achieve even more benefits from using the application.


  • help Center
    The Help Center offers the user many tutorial videos that help in learning how to use the application and all its tools, components, and features to make the most out of the application.

developers: VESALII COMPUTER SYSTEMS & COMMUNICATION EQUIPMENT SOFTWARE TRADING
ext_user_account_notice: Requires 3rd-Party Account: Account creation is required through our website https://www.vesalii.com/
name: Vesalii Anatomy VR Student

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel (R) Core i5 or equivalent
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Display Memory (VRAM): 2 GB and Shared Memory: 8 GB
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 10 GB available space
  • VR Support: HTC VIVE, HTC VIVE Cosmos, Meta Quest 2
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel (R) Core i7 or equivalent
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Display Memory (VRAM): 4 GB or more and Shared Memory: 8 GB
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 10 GB available space
  • VR Support: HTC VIVE, HTC VIVE Cosmos, Meta Quest 2

publishers: VESALII COMPUTER SYSTEMS & COMMUNICATION EQUIPMENT SOFTWARE TRADING
short_description: Vesalii Anatomy VR Student offers a powerful and visually detailed 3D application. The application allows users to view, explore, and interact with any system of the human body systems through an incredibly detailed 3D model.
supported_languages:
English*, French, German, Spanish - Spain, Arabic*, Portuguese - Portugal, Simplified Chinese, Turkish
*languages with full audio support
